sourceMeaningMnemonic: If you take a <radical>thread</radical> and wrap up a bunch of it, so much it becomes a <radical>hill</radical> of thread, you're going to have a lot of thread. You can wrap some of that thread around other thread to create a much thicker thread. This thread is a <kanji>cable</kanji>.
meaningInfo: Imagine yourself twisting this hill of thread up to make thicker cables. They're strong!
readingMnemonic: You use this <kanji>cable</kanji> to swing down from a building but you need to do i<reading>t soon</reading> (<ja>つな</ja>)! You're being chased by some bad guys and they've almost caught you, so if you're gonna swing to safety with this cable, you need to do it soon.
readingInfo: Gotta do it soon. Imagine swinging from this cable and feeling the wind in your hair.
